What happens when you execute "sudo which mysql"?

Oh you're using XAMPP, I hate that thing lol, I have issues like that too and end up just messing around to get things to work. Have you considered installing each package individually and not using XAMPP?
sudo apt-get install apache2 mysql-server mysql-client
Those names might be wrong, it was a best effort but you get the idea right?
From there your server root will be '/var/www/'
This is a "REAL" LAMPP server, where XAMPP is more of a simulation. Great if not better for developing in certain respects, but nobody uses XAMPP for production.
TO make things easier on you just fully remove XAMPP to avoid such things.

You'll learn a lot more this way as it's not some simulated enviroment. I had to use XAMPP for a course once and hated every moment of it lol. Was nice I could just bring around my whole production enviroment on a USB though. I'd say that's it's only advantage.
